title: Families of Boeing Crash Victims Can Challenge U.S. Settlement, Judge Rules
description: He said passengers killed on two 737 Max flights were crime victims, siding with relatives who objected to a deal that spared Boeing from a criminal charge.
dc:creator: Nicholas Kulish
category: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)
media:credit: Lindsey Wasson for The New York Times
media:description: Boeing, the manufacturer of the 737 Max, agreed to pay $2.5 billion last year to resolve a charge that it conspired to defraud the Federal Aviation Administration.
